study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the therapeutic potential of biologically active compounds and plant extracts in treating various types of anemia.
results_summary: The study highlights that biologically active compounds and plant extracts may serve as alternative or adjuvant therapies for anemia, offering advantages such as natural availability and potential to overcome limitations of conventional treatments like poor iron absorption and side effects.
population_specificity: People of all ages affected by various types of anemia.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review potential treatments, including antioxidants like vitamin E, for non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD) and its advanced forms.
results_summary: The abstract mentions antioxidants (such as vitamin E) as one of several potential agents investigated for NAFLD treatment, but it does not provide specific efficacy results for antioxidants. The review discusses various approaches without conclusive findings on antioxidants.
population_specificity: Adults with NAFLD, including those with type 2 diabetes (T2DM).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the therapeutic potential of marine algae-derived compounds, including antioxidants, for preventing and treating neurodegenerative and chronic diseases.
results_summary: The abstract highlights that marine algae contain bioactive compounds, including antioxidants, with potential therapeutic benefits for neurodegenerative diseases like Parkinson's, Alzheimer's, and Multiple Sclerosis, as well as other chronic conditions.
population_specificity: Patients with neurodegenerative and chronic diseases (e.g., Parkinson's, Alzheimer's, Multiple Sclerosis).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the anti-inflammatory, antioxidant, and immunomodulatory effects of onion (Allium cepa) and its constituents, particularly quercetin.
results_summary: The study found that onion and its constituents demonstrated beneficial effects on oxidative stress, inflammation, and immune system regulation, suggesting therapeutic potential for diseases linked to these conditions.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of existing literature).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of tomato powder and lycopene supplements on lipid peroxidation and antioxidant capacity in athletes after exhaustive exercise.
results_summary: Tomato powder increased total antioxidant capacity by 12% and reduced exercise-induced lipid peroxidation markers (8-isoprostane and MDA) compared to placebo, while lycopene supplements showed no significant difference from placebo.
population_specificity: Well-trained male athletes
effective_dosage: Tomato powder (30 mg lycopene, 5.38 mg beta-carotene, 22.32 mg phytoene, 9.84 mg phytofluene per serving); lycopene supplement (30 mg lycopene)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether creatine supplementation accelerates recovery from exercise-induced muscle damage by assessing muscle function, soreness, inflammation, and oxidative stress.
results_summary: Creatine supplementation did not significantly improve muscle strength, soreness, range of motion, or inflammation at any follow-up time. It only reduced creatine kinase activity at 48 hours post-exercise, with high heterogeneity across studies.
population_specificity: Adults aged 20-60 years (235 males, 43 females).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the potential of antioxidants to mitigate radiation nephropathy (RN) by reducing oxidative stress and inflammation.
results_summary: The study found that antioxidants, along with other interventions like RAAS blockade and anti-apoptotic drugs, reduced the severity of RN, suggesting their potential in preventing radiation-induced kidney toxicity.
population_specificity: Animal models (specific species not mentioned) and inferred clinical relevance to humans undergoing radiotherapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the potential of antioxidants, among other pharmacological substances, to enhance peripheral nerve repair after surgery.
results_summary: The abstract suggests antioxidants are among the most researched substances for enhancing peripheral nerve repair, but more research is needed to understand their mechanisms, efficacy, and safety.
population_specificity: Not specified (general review of literature on peripheral nerve injuries).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of oxidative stress and antioxidants in diabetic wound healing and discuss therapeutic strategies targeting oxidative stress.
results_summary: The study suggests that oxidative stress impairs diabetic wound healing and that reducing reactive oxygen species (ROS) through antioxidative systems may improve healing. Several therapeutic strategies, including dietary bioactive compounds, were discussed as potential interventions.
population_specificity: Individuals with diabetes mellitus, particularly those with foot ulcers.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the role of oxidative imbalance in inflammatory lung diseases and evaluate the potential of antioxidant treatment as a therapeutic option.
results_summary: Preclinical studies indicate antioxidants (alone or combined with anti-inflammatory drugs) are effective in treating inflammatory lung diseases, though clinical evidence is weaker. High ROS levels in these diseases disrupt signaling pathways, contributing to inflammation and glucocorticoid resistance.
population_specificity: Patients with inflammatory lung diseases (e.g., COPD, emphysema, corticosteroid-resistant asthma, COVID-19).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the radioprotective effects of nutraceuticals, focusing on their antioxidant properties and molecular mechanisms in protecting against radiation-induced damage.
results_summary: The study found that nutraceuticals like vitamin E, vitamin C, organosulphur compounds, phenylpropanoids, and polysaccharides effectively scavenge free radicals, modulate signaling pathways, and protect against DNA damage, inflammation, and hematopoietic cell depletion caused by radiation.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of existing literature on nutraceuticals and radioprotection).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the role of oxidative stress and antioxidant response in the progression from GERD to Barrett's esophagus (BE) and esophageal adenocarcinoma (EAC), and to evaluate potential therapeutic applications of antioxidants or NRF2 modulators.
results_summary: The study found that oxidative stress and compromised antioxidant capacity contribute to tumorigenesis in the GERD-BE-EAC sequence, with neoplastic cells adapting via pro-tumorigenic antioxidant responses. It suggests potential clinical applications for antioxidants or NRF2 activators in chemoprevention and NRF2 inhibitors in EAC treatment.
population_specificity: Patients with GERD, Barrett's esophagus (BE), or esophageal adenocarcinoma (EAC).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the regulatory role of heat shock proteins (HSPs) in oxidative stress and ischemia/reperfusion injury, focusing on pathways involving ROS.
results_summary: The study highlights the involvement of HSPs in mitigating oxidative stress and ischemia/reperfusion injury by aiding protein folding and refolding, with ROS playing a dual role in cell signaling and pathological processes.
population_specificity: Not specified (general biological pathways studied).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the role of oxidative stress response transcription factors (OSRts) and explore how plant-derived molecules, such as polyphenols, modulate these factors in cancer cells.
results_summary: The study discusses the dual role of oxidative stress in cancer cell survival and death, highlighting the modulation of OSRts (e.g., NRF2 and p53) by plant-derived molecules, which may act as both prooxidants and antioxidants. Preliminary data suggest these molecules could structurally perturb transcription factors to influence the oxidative stress response.
population_specificity: Not specified (focus on cancer cells and oxidative stress mechanisms).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess whether combining PDE5 inhibitors with antioxidants or other agents improved erectile dysfunction (ED) outcomes compared to monotherapy.
results_summary: Combination therapy with PDE5 inhibitors and antioxidants was associated with improved ED outcomes without increasing adverse events. Specific combinations like daily tadalafil, shockwave therapy, or vacuum devices showed additional benefits, though data was limited.
population_specificity: Men with ED, including subgroups with hypogonadism, monotherapy-resistant ED, or prostatectomy-induced ED (mean age 55.8 years).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate peptides as potential radioprotectants with fewer side effects and higher efficacy compared to primitive radioprotectors.
results_summary: The abstract suggests that peptides have been investigated as radioprotectants in preclinical models, indicating potential efficacy, but does not provide specific results or outcomes.
population_specificity: Preclinical models (not specified further)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effects of bilberry supplementation on glycemic control, lipid profile, antioxidant status, and inflammatory markers in patients with type 2 diabetes.
results_summary: Bilberry supplementation showed no significant effects on body weight, blood pressure, lipid profile, antioxidant status, oxidative stress, or inflammatory markers. There was a non-significant reduction in HbA1c, suggesting a potential but unconfirmed benefit for glycemic control.
population_specificity: Patients with type 2 diabetes (n=20).
study_duration: 4 weeks of supplementation, followed by 6 weeks of washout, and another 4 weeks of placebo (or vice versa).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the mechanisms and medical implications of herbal antioxidants (silymarin, curcumin, resveratrol, emodin, and quercetin) on dialysis-related complications in CKD patients.
results_summary: The study found that herbal antioxidants like silymarin, curcumin, resveratrol, emodin, and quercetin showed beneficial effects in ameliorating oxidative stress and inflammation in dialysis patients, with each compound exhibiting unique protective properties. However, the mechanisms and implications are complex and require further research.
population_specificity: Chronic kidney disease (CKD) patients undergoing dialysis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the protective role of Cucurbita spp. phytochemicals on oxidative stress-related disorders based on preclinical and human studies, as well as assess the antioxidant potential of the Cucurbitaceae family.
results_summary: The study found that Cucurbita species contain bioactive compounds like cucurbitacins, saponins, and polyphenols, which exhibit antioxidant, antitumor, antidiabetic, and other pharmacological effects. Clinical trials suggest health benefits for diabetic patients, those with benign prostate hyperplasia, infertile women, postmenopausal women, and women with stress urinary incontinence.
population_specificity: Diabetic patients, patients with benign prostate hyperplasia, infertile women, postmenopausal women, and women with stress urinary incontinence.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the molecular and chemico-biological interactions involving antioxidants in sepsis, focusing on immune cell alterations and organ dysfunction pathways.
results_summary: The abstract suggests that oxidative stress and altered redox homeostasis play a role in sepsis progression, but it does not provide specific results on antioxidant efficacy. The review highlights potential pathways for new therapeutic targets.
population_specificity: Patients with sepsis (generalized, no specific demographic details provided).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of edaravone dexborneol versus edaravone on 90-day functional outcomes in patients with acute ischemic stroke.
results_summary: The edaravone dexborneol group showed a significantly higher proportion of patients with good functional outcomes (modified Rankin Scale score ≤1) at 90 days compared to the edaravone group (67.18% vs. 58.97%). The odds ratio was 1.42 (95% CI, 1.12-1.81), indicating a favorable outcome for edaravone dexborneol.
population_specificity: Patients aged 35-80 with acute ischemic stroke (NIH Stroke Scale Score 4-24) within 48 hours of onset.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of nutritional supplements, including antioxidants, in preventing or mitigating the effects of sports-related concussion.
results_summary: The study found that antioxidants, among other supplements, showed promising results in aiding concussion recovery or prevention in animal studies and limited human trials, though more research is needed to confirm efficacy in humans.
population_specificity: Animal models (fluid percussion technique) and human studies of severe or moderate traumatic brain injury.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of selenium as an antioxidant therapy for Graves' hyperthyroidism (GH) and Graves' Orbitopathy (GO).
results_summary: The abstract suggests that selenium has been proposed as a therapy due to its antioxidant properties, but it does not provide specific results on its effectiveness. Multiple studies have been conducted, indicating ongoing research interest.
population_specificity: Patients with Graves' hyperthyroidism (GH) and Graves' Orbitopathy (GO).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the potential of exosomes as targeted carriers for enhancing endogenous antioxidants to treat oxidative stress in coronary heart disease.
results_summary: The study found that exogenous antioxidants are ineffective against oxidative stress, but exosomes may serve as targeted carriers to regulate endogenous ROS generation, offering advantages over stem-cell therapy.
population_specificity: Coronary heart disease patients (not explicitly specified, inferred from context).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of low-dose Canagliflozin (an SGLT2 inhibitor) on CD34+ progenitor cell function, including antioxidant gene expression, in patients with type 2 diabetes and chronic kidney disease.
results_summary: The study found that Canagliflozin treatment increased antioxidant gene expression (SOD2, Catalase, GPX) in CD34+ cells, improved migratory function, and enhanced endothelial markers. It also reduced glucose levels, HbA1c, blood pressure, and urinary podocyte protein leakage.
population_specificity: Type 2 diabetes patients (30-70 years old) with HbA1c 7-10% and established chronic kidney disease.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the neuroprotective mechanisms of the dietary polyphenol Resveratrol (RV) and its potential benefits in preventing cognitive decline and neurodegenerative diseases.
results_summary: The study found that RV exhibits antioxidant and cytoprotective effects, mitigating oxidative stress, DNA damage, mitochondrial dysfunction, inflammation, and epigenetic changes. It also interacts with gut microbiota, enhancing beneficial effects and showing potential for neuroprotection across generations.
population_specificity: Elderly individuals and those at risk for neurodegenerative diseases (e.g., Alzheimer's and Parkinson's).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the role of oxidative stress and low-grade inflammation in the pathophysiology of PCOS, including their potential to induce obesity, insulin resistance, and other metabolic disturbances.
results_summary: The study highlights oxidative stress and low-grade inflammation as key contributors to PCOS, suggesting they may worsen obesity, insulin resistance, and vitamin D deficiency, with a potential bidirectional relationship between oxidative stress and metabolic dysfunction.
population_specificity: Women with Polycystic Ovary Syndrome (PCOS), including both obese and normal-weight individuals.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of aqueous extract of Phyllanthus emblica on essential hypertension and its potential protective actions, including antioxidant capacity and lipid profile.
results_summary: Phyllanthus emblica did not produce additional reductions in blood pressure or improvements in oxidant status, antioxidant capacity, lipid profile, HbA1C, arterial stiffness, or hs-CRP levels compared to placebo. The treatment had a good safety profile but no significant efficacy.
population_specificity: 150 patients with essential hypertension.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the role of oxidative stress-related mechanisms, including genetic and molecular factors, in the phenotypic manifestation of schizophrenia.
results_summary: The abstract suggests that oxidative stress mechanisms, such as glutathione deficiency and impaired redox-sensitive transcriptional factors, contribute to schizophrenia's heterogeneity and manifestation, but it does not report specific findings on antioxidant interventions.
population_specificity: Individuals with schizophrenia (no specific demographic details provided).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the connection between oxidative stress, inflammation, and cardiovascular disease, and assess potential cardioprotective interventions, including antioxidants.
results_summary: The study found that while oxidative stress and inflammation are linked to cardiovascular disease, clinical applications of antioxidants have been rare and largely unsuccessful. Specific anti-inflammatory therapies, however, showed promise in reducing cardiovascular mortality.
population_specificity: Patients with pre-existing atherosclerotic disease.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the role of antioxidants in pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC) and evaluate therapeutic strategies to increase ROS levels for inducing cancer cell death.
results_summary: The study found that cancer cells adapt to high ROS levels, which contribute to tumor progression and therapy resistance. Combining ROS promotion with antioxidant inhibition shows promise for PDAC treatment.
population_specificity: Pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC) cells.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify noninflammatory biomarkers in cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) related to brain injury in perinatal asphyxia or hypoxic-ischemic encephalopathy (HIE), focusing on oxidants and antioxidants.
results_summary: The study identified promising CSF biomarkers, including superoxide dismutase and malondialdehyde, for prognostication in severe HIE, suggesting their potential role in oxidative stress-related brain injury.
population_specificity: Neonates with perinatal asphyxia or hypoxic-ischemic encephalopathy (HIE), including term and preterm newborns.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review viral evasion strategies and explore potential therapeutic tools, including antioxidants, for controlling viral infections.
results_summary: The abstract discusses viral manipulation of host cellular environments and suggests antioxidants as a potential therapeutic strategy, but no specific results on antioxidant efficacy or safety are provided.
population_specificity: Not specified (general review of viral infections)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize current knowledge on the regulatory mechanisms of ferroptosis and evaluate the therapeutic potential of ferroptosis inhibitors, including antioxidants, in treating diseases like cancer and neurodegenerative disorders.
results_summary: The study found that ferroptosis can be prevented by small lipophilic antioxidants (e.g., ferrostatin, liproxstatin) and highlighted their role in mitigating lipid peroxidation, suggesting therapeutic potential for diseases linked to ferroptosis, such as cancer and neurodegenerative conditions.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of existing literature).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate whether micronized progesterone (MP), topically or systemically applied, could effectively prevent or slow signs of skin and hair aging in menopausal women.
results_summary: Two out of three studies reported benefits of MP on skin aging markers, with one showing efficacy for topical MP and another for systemic MP as part of combined menopausal hormone therapy. No studies investigated MP's impact on scalp hair aging.
population_specificity: Menopausal women

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of resistance training on the antioxidant defense system in sedentary adults with Down syndrome.
results_summary: The study found that resistance training improved plasma total antioxidant status (TAS), reduced glutathione (GHS), and ascorbate levels in adults with Down syndrome. However, the abstract does not provide detailed statistical outcomes or clinical relevance.
population_specificity: Sedentary male adults with Down syndrome.
effective_dosage: Not specified (resistance training program with 6 stations, 3 days/week).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the mechanisms of resveratrol as an antioxidant in preventing and treating various ocular diseases, focusing on its cellular, molecular, and physiological effects.
results_summary: The study highlights resveratrol's potential in combating ocular diseases by regulating reactive oxygen species, inflammatory processes, and epigenetic activation of sirtuin-1, though more preclinical studies are needed to confirm its adjuvant role.
population_specificity: Focus on ocular diseases (age-related macular degeneration, glaucoma, cataract, diabetic retinopathy, vitreoretinopathy).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the potential of natural antioxidants in treating cardiovascular diseases by regulating mitochondrial quality control.
results_summary: The study found that natural antioxidants can protect myocardial and endothelial cells from stress-induced injury by improving mitochondrial quality control, with preliminary evidence supporting their safety and effectiveness.
population_specificity: Myocardial and vascular endothelial cells (in vitro or animal models implied, not explicitly stated).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the role of antioxidants, specifically Peroxiredoxin 4 (Prx4), in mitigating oxidative stress and blood-brain barrier disruption following cerebral ischemia/reperfusion injury.
results_summary: The study found that antioxidants can inhibit ROS generation and attenuate BBB disruption after cerebral I/R, suggesting potential protective effects against ischemic stroke-related damage. Previous studies support these findings, indicating antioxidants may reduce oxidative stress-mediated inflammatory processes in endothelial cells.
population_specificity: Not specified (likely animal or in vitro models based on context).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize recent findings on the pharmacological properties, molecular targets, and mechanisms of action of secoiridoids in EVOO, focusing on their preventive and anti-cancer activities.
results_summary: The study found that secoiridoids in EVOO exhibit antioxidant, anti-inflammatory, and anti-proliferative properties, demonstrating potential anti-cancer activity. Preclinical studies support their use as agents against various human cancers, with prospects for prevention and treatment.
population_specificity: Not specified (preclinical, in vitro, and in vivo studies)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the role of oxidative stress and mitochondrial dysfunction in inborn errors of metabolism (IEMs) and assess the potential of antioxidants and mitochondria-targeted therapies as treatments.
results_summary: The study found elevated reactive oxygen species (ROS) levels and reduced antioxidant defenses in IEMs, correlating with oxidative damage. Antioxidants and mitochondria-targeted therapies showed promise as therapeutic components, but further research is needed.
population_specificity: Pediatric and other patients with inborn errors of metabolism (IEMs), including branched-chain amino acid disorders, organic acidurias, and homocystinuria.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the antioxidant, anti-inflammatory, antiviral, antitumor, and immunoregulatory properties of glycyrrhizic acid (GL) and glycyrrhetinic acid (GA) in licorice extract.
results_summary: The study found that GL and GA exhibit potent antioxidant, anti-inflammatory, and antiviral effects against multiple viruses, including hepatitis A, B, and C, HIV-1, herpes simplex, influenza A, SARS-related coronavirus, and others. GA also showed therapeutic potential against human enterovirus 71, a major cause of hand, foot, and mouth disease.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro or in vivo studies implied but not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of natural antioxidants as a multi-pathway therapeutic approach for dementia and Alzheimer's disease, addressing limitations like bioavailability and optimal dosing.
results_summary: The study highlights that natural antioxidants show promise in vitro and in animal models for combating oxidative stress and neuroinflammation in dementia, but human trials face challenges such as limited bioavailability and undefined optimal dosing. Ongoing research is exploring modifications to improve these compounds for clinical use.
population_specificity: Not specified (abstract discusses general implications for dementia and Alzheimer's disease).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effects of daily selenium (Se) supplementation on ICU patient outcomes, including survival, hospital/ICU stay, mechanical ventilation duration, infection, acute renal failure (ARF), and serum creatinine levels.
results_summary: The meta-analysis found no significant overall effect of parenteral Se on most outcomes, but high doses (>1000 μg/d) increased ICU stay length, while lower doses (≤1000 μg) reduced ARF occurrence.
population_specificity: ICU patients

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the potential benefits of antioxidants derived from purple carrot and cabbage, along with other interventions, in mitigating the detrimental effects of COVID-19.
results_summary: The study suggests that antioxidants from purple carrot and cabbage, combined with anti-coagulants, may help prevent or lessen COVID-19 complications. It also proposes the use of doxycycline and anti-acids as potential treatments.
population_specificity: COVID-19 subjects (no specific demographic details provided).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review recent innovations in sericin-based nano-medicines and their potential therapeutic applications, including antioxidant properties.
results_summary: The study highlights sericin's inherent biological properties, such as antioxidant effects, and its potential use in pharmaceutical formulations for various biomedical applications, including non-conventional therapies.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of existing research).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the dual role of bilirubin as both a neurotoxin and a potent antioxidant in neonatal hyperbilirubinemia.
results_summary: The study found that bilirubin at high concentrations causes neurotoxicity and oxidative stress but also acts as a powerful antioxidant. Understanding these mechanisms could improve personalized phototherapy indications.
population_specificity: Newborn infants with hyperbilirubinemia.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of Ocoxin, a plant-based antioxidant supplement, on mitigating chemotherapy and radiotherapy side effects and its potential as an anticancer agent.
results_summary: Ocoxin reduced chemotherapy and radiotherapy-related side effects, including radiation-induced skin burns, mucositis, diarrhea, hepatic toxicity, and blood infections, and showed efficacy as an anticancer agent in various tumor models.
population_specificity: Cancer patients undergoing chemotherapy and radiotherapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the regulatory role of specific lncRNAs in modulating the transcriptional activities of Nrf2, a critical antioxidant transcription factor, in various physiological and pathophysiological conditions.
results_summary: The study found that certain lncRNAs (e.g., lncRNA ROR, ENSMUST00000125413, lncRNA ODRUL, Nrf2-lncRNA) are associated with the Nrf2 signaling pathway, suggesting their potential role in regulating Nrf2's transcriptional activities in response to stress and other stimuli. The review highlights Nrf2 as a key therapeutic target due to its downregulation in chronic diseases.
population_specificity: Not specified (general focus on cellular and molecular mechanisms)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the potential of extracellular vesicles (EVs) as a novel therapeutic delivery platform for Parkinson's disease (PD), including the role of antioxidants in alleviating motor symptoms.
results_summary: The study highlights that antioxidants, among other treatments, can partially alleviate PD motor symptoms but are limited by the blood-brain barrier (BBB). EVs show promise for improving drug delivery efficiency, including antioxidants, due to their ability to cross the BBB.
population_specificity: Patients with Parkinson's disease (PD).

study_goal: The researchers were attempting to determine the role of antioxidants in addressing oxidative stress in neurodegenerative diseases and their potential therapeutic efficacy.
results_summary: The study suggests that antioxidants were unsuccessful in circumventing neurodegenerative diseases, despite the known increase in oxidative stress and reactive oxygen species (ROS). Recent findings indicate that ROS may function as secondary messengers, complicating the therapeutic approach.
population_specificity: Not specified (general focus on neurodegenerative diseases).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the role of oxidative DNA damage in colitis-associated colon cancer (CAC) and the potential of exogenous antioxidants to prevent these cancers in the context of chronic intestinal inflammation.
results_summary: The abstract suggests that preclinical and clinical studies indicate antioxidants can reduce intestinal oxidation, but most clinical studies focus on short-term effects in IBD patients rather than CAC prevention. The chronic oxidative environment in the intestine may contribute to DNA lesions leading to colon carcinogenesis in IBD patients.
population_specificity: Inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) patients at risk for colitis-associated colon cancer (CAC).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the role of vitamin D in epigenetics, gene regulation, and its ability to control oxidative stress in conjunction with antioxidants.
results_summary: The study found that vitamin D deficiency increases the incidence and severity of oxidative stress-related disorders, and normalization of vitamin D levels may improve clinical outcomes by regulating epigenetic mechanisms and oxidative stress.
population_specificity: General human population, with specific mentions of conditions like obesity, diabetes, hypertension, and autoimmune diseases.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review potential therapeutic options for Barth syndrome, including mitochondria-targeted antioxidants, and discuss their clinical and cellular pathophysiology.
results_summary: The abstract highlights promising therapeutic options for Barth syndrome, including mitochondria-targeted antioxidants, but does not provide specific efficacy data for antioxidants alone.
population_specificity: Patients with Barth syndrome, a rare X-linked genetic disease.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize the role of clinical nutrition, including an antioxidant-rich diet, in lung cancer treatment and patient care.
results_summary: The study found that an anti-inflammatory diet rich in antioxidants can reduce the risk of lung cancer initiation and progression, support tissue regeneration, and improve nutritional status during and after treatment.
population_specificity: Lung cancer patients and those at risk of lung cancer.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review targets related to anti-oxidative stress and the research status of agonists/inhibitors for these targets to guide future research and clinical applications.
results_summary: The study identified various targets (e.g., nuclear transcription factors, enzymes, SLC7A11 genes) involved in oxidative stress and discussed their roles, including potential anti-tumor effects. It also reviewed existing agonists/inhibitors for these targets.
population_specificity: Not specified (review study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine why clinical trials involving high-dose antioxidant vitamin E or strict glycemic control failed to reduce CVD in DM patients and proposed a precision medicine approach based on the Hp genotype.
results_summary: The study found that previous trials failed due to improper patient selection, but small studies showed benefit in high-risk Hp genotype individuals treated with antioxidants or aggressive glycemic control, suggesting a precision medicine approach could reduce diabetes complications.
population_specificity: Individuals with diabetes mellitus (DM), specifically those with the high-risk haptoglobin (Hp) genotype.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of curcumin and nano-curcumin on lipid profile, oxidative stress, and inflammatory factors in cardiac patients undergoing elective angioplasty.
results_summary: Both curcumin and nano-curcumin significantly improved lipid profiles (TC, TG, LDL-C), oxidative stress markers (TAC, MDA, SOD, GSH-Px), and inflammatory factors (hs-CRP, IL-1β, TNF-α) compared to placebo. Nano-curcumin showed superior effects in TC, TG, SOD, MDA, and TNF-α levels compared to standard curcumin.
population_specificity: 90 patients undergoing elective coronary angioplasty.
effective_dosage: 500 mg curcumin daily (first group), 80 mg nano-curcumin daily (second group).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the oxidant/antioxidant status in endometriosis patients and evaluate antioxidant therapy as an alternative to hormonal treatment.
results_summary: The study found that excessive oxidative stress in endometriosis leads to redox imbalance, and certain antioxidants (polyphenols, dopamine agonists, statins) may help reduce endometriosis-related pain, though clinical trials are lacking.
population_specificity: Patients with endometriosis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the potential of peptides, cytokines, tissue engineering, genetic engineering, advanced stem cell therapy, and polyphenolic phytochemicals in treating damaged tissues and neurodegenerative diseases.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific results regarding antioxidants but highlights the current limitations in regenerative therapy and the need for advanced treatments for neurodegenerative diseases.
population_specificity: Not specified

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the bioactive compounds in taro corms and their potential health benefits, including antioxidant, anti-inflammatory, and antitumoral effects.
results_summary: The study found that taro corms contain multiple bioactive compounds with broad health-promoting effects, including antioxidant, anti-inflammatory, and immunomodulatory activities, supported by in vitro and in vivo evidence.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro and in vivo studies implied).

study_goal: To examine the impacts of the DASH diet on oxidative stress parameters through a systematic review and meta-analysis.
results_summary: The DASH diet significantly decreased malondialdehyde (MDA) and increased glutathione (GSH) levels, with a trend toward improving total antioxidant capacity (TAC), nitric oxide (NO), and f2-isoprostanes. However, long-term, large-scale trials are needed for definitive conclusions.
population_specificity: 317 subjects across eight studies (200 participants in the meta-analysis).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effectiveness of hibiscus antioxidants in improving biomarkers of metabolic syndrome, including hyperglycemia, hypertriglyceridemia, low HDL, obesity, and hypertension.
results_summary: Hibiscus improved multiple metabolic syndrome biomarkers, such as blood glucose, cholesterol, triglycerides, blood pressure, and weight, often matching or surpassing pharmaceutical effectiveness, especially for glucose and insulin sensitivity. Higher doses sometimes yielded greater benefits, but lower doses were frequently equally effective.
population_specificity: Human subjects and other animals (specific demographics not detailed).
effective_dosage: Not specified (higher and lower doses mentioned but not quantified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of daily consumption of an antioxidant mix (bacopa, lycopene, astaxanthin, and vitamin B12) on cognitive function in healthy older adults.
results_summary: The antioxidant mix significantly improved cognitive function, as measured by TMT-B scores, with the active group showing a decrease of -17.63 s compared to an increase of +3.46 s in the placebo group. The treatment difference was -21.01 s, favoring the active group with a statistically significant 95% confidence interval.
population_specificity: Healthy older adults aged 60 years or more with no evidence of cognitive dysfunction.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the role of nutrients, including antioxidants, and food contaminants in oxidative stress and their influence on NAFLD pathogenesis.
results_summary: The abstract suggests that antioxidants may influence NAFLD pathogenesis by addressing oxidative stress, but it does not provide specific efficacy data. The study highlights the broader context of nutrient impact on NAFLD without conclusive antioxidant-specific outcomes.
population_specificity: Not specified (general NAFLD/NASH context)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of various treatments for NASH, including antioxidants, focusing on histological improvements such as fibrosis reduction.
results_summary: Antioxidants were found to be the best treatment for fibrosis improvement in NASH patients, though other treatments like pioglitazone and RYGB were more effective for overall NAS reduction. Promising treatments like elafibranor and obeticholic acid did not significantly reduce NAS or fibrosis.
population_specificity: Adults with histologically proven NASH (55.6% men).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the role of reactive oxygen species in ischemia/reperfusion damage and evaluate potential redox-based therapies, including antioxidants, for myocardial infarction and heart failure.
results_summary: The study highlights the central role of reactive oxygen species in ischemia/reperfusion damage and discusses potential redox-based therapies, such as mitochondria-targeted antioxidants, which have shown success in preclinical models. However, the dual role of reactive oxygen species in both detrimental and protective signaling complicates redox therapy.
population_specificity: Preclinical models of myocardial infarction and heart failure (human epidemiological context referenced but not primary study population).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the depletion of antioxidants in kwashiorkor versus marasmus and explore the microbial and metabolic mechanisms underlying these differences.
results_summary: The study found that kwashiorkor involves more severe depletion of antioxidants, vitamins, and minerals compared to marasmus, linked to oxidative stress, gut microbiota alterations, and liver dysfunction. Interventions like glutathione correction, essential amino acids, and targeted antibiotics could improve outcomes.
population_specificity: Children with severe acute malnutrition (kwashiorkor and marasmus).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of mitochondrial dysfunction and oxidative stress in diseases like MELAS syndrome and neurodegenerative disorders using molecular imaging techniques.
results_summary: The study found that molecular imaging (PET and MRI) revealed mitochondrial metabolic impairments and increased oxidative stress in patients with MELAS syndrome, Parkinson's disease, and amyotrophic lateral sclerosis, correlating with clinical severity.
population_specificity: Patients with mitochondrial diseases (e.g., MELAS syndrome) and neurodegenerative disorders (e.g., Parkinson's disease, amyotrophic lateral sclerosis).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of curcumin as a protective antioxidant against cadmium-induced organ toxicity.
results_summary: The study found that curcumin exhibits antioxidant, anti-inflammatory, and anti-tumorigenic properties, which help mitigate cadmium-induced oxidative stress and organ damage. It scavenges reactive oxygen species (ROS) and reduces cadmium accumulation, demonstrating therapeutic potential.
population_specificity: Not specified (general focus on heavy metal-induced toxicity).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether (poly)phenol supplementation enhances physiological adaptations to exercise training.
results_summary: The study found that (poly)phenols had no effect on training-induced adaptations in muscle strength and peak power output. Most studies were free from bias, with isoflavones and green tea (poly)phenols being the most frequently administered supplements.
population_specificity: Adult humans undergoing supervised exercise training for at least 2 weeks.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the therapeutic potential of mitochondria-targeted antioxidants (MTAs) for treating oxidative damage-associated diseases and compare their advantages to conventional antioxidants.
results_summary: The study found that MTAs show promise in treating various diseases by targeting mitochondrial redox homeostasis, with positive experimental results in animal models and clinical trials, though limitations and further research needs were noted.
population_specificity: Animal models and clinical trials (specific human populations not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the pharmacodynamics-pharmacokinetics of mangiferin and its neurotherapeutic potential in neurological disorders.
results_summary: Mangiferin demonstrated neuroprotective effects by attenuating cerebral infarction, edema, lipid peroxidation, and neuronal damage, while enhancing endogenous antioxidants and regulating proinflammatory cytokines. It counteracted neurotoxic effects of substances like amyloid-beta and MPTP, suggesting therapeutic potential for neurological disorders.
population_specificity: In-vitro and in-vivo models (not specified if human or animal).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effect of dental treatment on the redox balance of the oral cavity and explore whether antioxidants could mitigate oxidative stress caused by dental procedures.
results_summary: The study found that various dental treatments (composites, amalgams, braces, implants, etc.) disturb oral redox homeostasis by increasing oxidative damage to salivary components. It suggested that adding antioxidants to dental materials or using antioxidant therapy during treatment could protect against oxidative stress.
population_specificity: Dental patients undergoing various treatments (e.g., fillings, braces, implants).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of different antioxidant combinations in reducing sperm DNA fragmentation in infertile men.
results_summary: The study found a statistically significant decrease in sperm DNA damage after 3 months of antioxidant treatment across all groups, but no significant difference between the different antioxidant combinations. The complexity of the combination did not enhance treatment success and may have drawbacks like increased cost or reduced compliance.
population_specificity: Infertile men with sperm DNA fragmentation of 30% or higher.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the evidence-based benefits of alpha-lipoic acid (ALA) in addressing female and male infertility by examining its effects on oxidative stress-related reproductive processes.
results_summary: The study found that ALA positively influenced oocyte maturation and sperm quality, suggesting its potential role in improving fertility outcomes. However, more clinical studies are needed to confirm its efficacy in clinical practice.
population_specificity: Sub-fertile men and women experiencing infertility due to oxidative stress.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to provide a comprehensive overview of IDO1 inhibitors, including their role as antioxidants, and their potential therapeutic applications in diseases like cancer and COVID-19.
results_summary: The study highlights the diverse chemical space of IDO1 inhibitors, their structure-activity relationships, and their potential to modulate the immune system, particularly in cancer progression and possibly COVID-19 treatment.
population_specificity: Not specified (focused on biochemical and pharmacological research).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether supplementation with antioxidants could reduce genomic damage in CKD patients, as measured by micronucleus frequency.
results_summary: The study found that genomic damage is elevated in CKD patients and that supplementation with antioxidants may in some cases lower this damage. Meta-analysis confirmed significant levels of genomic damage in CKD patients compared to healthy controls.
population_specificity: Chronic kidney disease (CKD) patients, including those in predialysis or hemodialysis stages.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the antimicrobial and antioxidant potential of phenolic compounds isolated from olive leaf extract, as well as methods for their isolation and characterization.
results_summary: The study highlights the strong antimicrobial activity of olive leaf phenolic compounds and their potential as low-cost alternatives to antibiotics, while also emphasizing their antioxidant properties and the role of olive leaves as industrial and agricultural waste.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of existing research)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the role of oxidative stress in Alzheimer's disease (AD) and evaluate the potential therapeutic effects of antioxidants in preventing or delaying AD progression.
results_summary: The abstract highlights that oxidative stress contributes to AD pathogenesis and suggests emerging evidence supports antioxidants as a therapeutic intervention to mitigate AD pathology.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of general AD pathology and antioxidant effects).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of flavonoids, derived from Chinese herbal medicine, as a complementary therapy to mitigate radiation-induced brain damage and cognitive impairment.
results_summary: The study found that flavonoids exhibit neuroprotective and radioprotective properties through antioxidant, anti-inflammatory effects, and genomic stability maintenance, suggesting their potential to prevent radiotherapy-induced brain damage.
population_specificity: Patients receiving brain radiotherapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the role of mitochondrial oxidative function and endogenous antioxidants in non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD) and insulin resistance (IR).
results_summary: The study suggests that NAFLD and IR may elevate mitochondrial function to meet increased metabolic demands, and that targeting mitochondrial fuel preference rather than ATP-synthesizing respiration could be more effective for treating NAFLD. It also highlights the role of endogenous antioxidants in regulating mitochondrial redox-sensitive signaling pathways.
population_specificity: Not specified (focus on mechanisms in NAFLD and IR).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the role of oxidative stress-related mechanisms in ALS and evaluate the effectiveness of various antioxidant compounds tested in preclinical and clinical trials.
results_summary: The study found that while oxidative stress is implicated in ALS neurodegeneration, several antioxidants that showed promise in animal models failed to demonstrate therapeutic benefits in human patients. The authors emphasize the need for personalized antioxidant therapies based on patient-specific oxidative stress profiles.
population_specificity: Patients with amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the potential benefits of antioxidants in improving immune response, managing chronic diseases, and providing antiviral effects in COVID-19 patients with comorbidities.
results_summary: The study suggests that foods rich in antioxidants, vitamins, and minerals may enhance immune function and help manage chronic diseases, potentially reducing COVID-19 complications. However, the abstract does not provide specific data on the effectiveness of antioxidants.
population_specificity: COVID-19-infected patients with chronic diseases (e.g., diabetes, hypertension).
interactions: Some medications for diabetes or hypertension may interact with COVID-19 infection, but specific antioxidant interactions are not mentioned.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the neuroprotective potential of quercetin and other bioactive natural compounds in mitigating oxidative stress-related pediatric neurological diseases such as CNS tumors, ASD, and ADHD.
results_summary: The study found that quercetin exhibits promising neuroprotective effects against oxidative stress, with potential benefits including anti-cancer, anti-inflammatory, anti-viral, anti-obesity, and anti-microbial properties, making it a suitable adjuvant therapy for pediatric neurological diseases.
population_specificity: Pediatric patients with neurological diseases (CNS tumors, ASD, ADHD).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of oral α-lipoic acid (ALA) in combination with NB-UVB phototherapy for treating nonsegmental stable vitiligo.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference in repigmentation rates between the ALA and placebo groups at any timepoint, indicating ALA did not provide additional benefit to NB-UVB therapy. The percentages of patients achieving ≥50% improvement were similar in both groups.
population_specificity: Patients with nonsegmental stable vitiligo in China.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of a cream containing nanoparticles with vitamin E on preventing radiodermatitis in breast cancer patients undergoing radiotherapy.
results_summary: The abstract describes a study protocol but does not report results; it outlines a planned triple-blinded, randomized, controlled trial to assess the efficacy of the cream.
population_specificity: 108 women with breast cancer receiving radiotherapy.
study_duration: From the start of radiotherapy until two weeks after the last session.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate whether combining zinc (an antioxidant) with hydroxychloroquine (HCQ) improved clinical outcomes in COVID-19 patients compared to HCQ alone.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference in recovery rates, need for mechanical ventilation, or mortality between patients receiving HCQ plus zinc and those receiving HCQ alone, suggesting zinc did not enhance HCQ's efficacy.
population_specificity: 191 COVID-19 patients in Egypt, randomized into two groups.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of curcumin and zinc co-supplementation on glycemic measurements, lipid profiles, and inflammatory and antioxidant biomarkers in prediabetic patients.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific results, as the study is described as a planned randomized controlled trial (RCT) without reported outcomes. The discussion suggests potential benefits but emphasizes the need for further evidence.
population_specificity: Prediabetic patients (18-50 years old for men, 18 years to pre-menopause for women) with a BMI between 25 and 35.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate whether maternal antioxidant interventions could prevent or alleviate negative health outcomes in offspring exposed to adverse perinatal conditions.
results_summary: The abstract suggests that maternal antioxidant interventions, among other nutritional strategies, may help mitigate adverse developmental and health outcomes in offspring, though specific efficacy data for antioxidants alone are not detailed.
population_specificity: Animal models (mothers and offspring) exposed to adverse perinatal conditions.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the neuroprotective role of anthocyanins, focusing on their antioxidant and anti-inflammatory properties in preventing and treating neurological disorders.
results_summary: The study found that anthocyanins exhibit significant neuroprotective effects, primarily due to their antioxidant and anti-inflammatory properties, and may modulate neuroinflammation in various brain diseases.
population_specificity: Not specified (general neurological disorder context).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify and review Iranian medicinal plants rich in antioxidants and biological compounds for their potential in wound healing.
results_summary: The study identified 139 medicinal plants effective for wound healing, highlighting key plants like Salvia officinalis and Aloe vera, which are rich in antioxidants and may aid in wound repair and drug development.
population_specificity: Not specified (ethnopharmacology and ethnobotanical sources of Iran).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether combining pregabalin with antioxidant therapy effectively reduces pain in patients with chronic pancreatitis.
results_summary: The combination significantly reduced pain intensity, decreased non-opioid analgesic requirements, lowered hospital admissions, and improved patient satisfaction compared to placebo.
population_specificity: Patients with chronic pancreatitis (90 participants, 45 per group).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effects of vitamin E and N-acetyl cysteine (NAC) on oxidative stress and antioxidant capacity in transfusion-dependent β-thalassemia (TDT) patients.
results_summary: Vitamin E significantly reduced total oxidative stress (TOS), while both vitamin E and NAC improved total antioxidant capacity (TAC). Hemoglobin levels remained unchanged, and mild transient adverse events occurred in a few patients without treatment discontinuation.
population_specificity: 78 transfusion-dependent β-thalassemia patients aged 18-41 years.
effective_dosage: NAC (10 mg/kg/day, orally), vitamin E (10 U/kg/day, orally).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the dual role of antioxidants in affecting tumor and healthy cells, focusing on their potential to both inhibit and promote cancer progression.
results_summary: The study found that antioxidants can suppress ROS-dependent cell proliferation and metastasis but may also inhibit tumor cell death when oxidative stress is induced by antitumor therapy. The effects of dietary antioxidants during antitumor therapy remain contradictory.
population_specificity: Not specified (general discussion of tumor and healthy cells).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the potential disease-modifying effects of antioxidants in Parkinson's disease, alongside other therapeutic strategies.
results_summary: The abstract notes that results from trials involving antioxidants and other treatments for Parkinson's disease have been disappointing, despite their mechanistic diversity and initial promise.
population_specificity: Patients with Parkinson's disease (specific demographics not detailed in the abstract).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of dietary antioxidants, such as vitamins and carotenoids, on the prevention and progression of cervical cancer associated with HPV infection.
results_summary: The study found that vitamins A, D, C, E, carotenoids, and folate may inhibit various stages of cervical cancer development, while polyphenols showed potential in combination therapy. Intake of vegetables and fruits containing multiple vitamins was also associated with suppression of cervical cancer progression.
population_specificity: Individuals at risk of or affected by HPV-related cervical cancer.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the potential of natural and synthetic compounds, including antioxidants, to inhibit the NF-κB pathway as a mechanism to treat NF-κB-induced tumors.
results_summary: The study found that several natural compounds, including antioxidants, exhibit anticancer and anti-inflammatory activities by inhibiting the NF-κB pathway in various cancer types, suggesting their potential as therapeutic agents.
population_specificity: Various cancer types (breast, lung, liver, pancreatic, prostate, and lymphomas)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to analyze the role of oxidative stress and the effects of antioxidant and repair systems in the retina, particularly in relation to age-related macular degeneration.
results_summary: The study found that oxidative stress and related inflammation may contribute to retinal degeneration, and antioxidant treatments may support tissue protection. Recent studies suggest supplying sufficient energy to activate repair systems could help maintain homeostasis.
population_specificity: Retinal tissue, particularly in the context of age-related macular degeneration.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of sitagliptin with and without a synbiotic supplement on liver enzymes, including aspartate aminotransferase (AST), in patients with NAFLD.
results_summary: The study found that the sitagliptin-synbiotic combination significantly improved AST levels compared to sitagliptin alone, alongside greater improvements in fasting blood glucose, cholesterol, and LDL.
population_specificity: 138 NAFLD patients aged 18-60 years.
effective_dosage: Sitagliptin 50 mg daily plus synbiotic (one capsule per day).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether a multinutrient supplement containing aspartate could enhance game-based running performance and mitigate muscle damage in rugby players.
results_summary: The supplement improved very high-intensity running performance but was associated with increased markers of muscle damage (AST and CK), though CRP elevation was blunted. Correlations suggested potential masking of anticatabolic effects due to increased high-intensity work.
population_specificity: Twelve male rugby union players.
effective_dosage: Not specified (referred to as "comprehensive multinutrient supplement").

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether AST-SAC (astaxanthin-s-allyl cysteine diester) could protect pancreatic β-cells from glucolipotoxicity-induced damage and maintain insulin secretion.
results_summary: AST-SAC treatment reduced oxidative stress, mitochondrial dysfunction, DNA damage, and ER stress in β-cells exposed to high glucose and palmitate, preserving cell viability and insulin secretion. It also normalized mTOR pathway proteins and mitigated ER stress-related gene expression.
population_specificity: Mus musculus pancreatic β-cell line (βTC-tet)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if 12 mg/d of Astaxanthin could reduce inflammation, oxidative stress, and improve cardiometabolic health and exercise performance in firefighters.
results_summary: Astaxanthin lessened inflammatory responses to exercise and attenuated increases in interleukin-1β, cortisol, and uric acid after fire suppressive activities, but did not significantly affect fasting oxidative stress markers, blood lipids, or performance in fire ground tests.
population_specificity: 15 male career firefighters (34.5 ± 7.4 years, BMI 30.1 ± 2.9 kg/m²).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether dopamine (DA) treatment could enhance biomass and astaxanthin production in *Haematococcus lacustris* under stressful conditions.
results_summary: DA treatment significantly increased biomass, astaxanthin content, and productivity while promoting lipid synthesis and upregulating carotenogenesis-related genes. It also reduced oxidative stress and autophagy, enhancing astaxanthin accumulation.
population_specificity: *Haematococcus lacustris* (a microalga) under salinity and high-light stress.
effective_dosage: 25 μM DA combined with 1 g L⁻¹ sodium chloride.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the relationship between plasma homocysteine levels, folic acid supplementation, and hemato-biochemical parameters, including aspartate transaminase (AST), in sickle cell anemia patients and their impact on vaso-occlusive crisis (VOC).
results_summary: The study found that plasma homocysteine levels were significantly higher in sickle cell anemia patients and correlated positively with AST levels. Folic acid supplementation reduced homocysteine levels, suggesting a potential indirect effect on AST-related outcomes.
population_specificity: Asian-Indian haplotype population with sickle cell anemia (120 cases) and controls with normal hemoglobin (50 individuals).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify noninvasive markers, including aspartate aminotransferase to platelet ratio index (APRI), for assessing the severity of cirrhosis in patients with primary biliary cholangitis (PBC).
results_summary: The study found that advanced-stage cirrhosis was associated with significantly higher APRI values compared to early-stage cirrhosis, indicating its potential as a diagnostic marker. RLR (RDW to lymphocyte ratio) showed the highest diagnostic accuracy among the markers evaluated.
population_specificity: 94 patients with histologically-confirmed PBC, divided into early-stage (F1-F2) and advanced-stage (F3-F4) cirrhosis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of different dietary sources and doses of astaxanthin on fillet coloration, texture, and nutrient composition in rainbow trout.
results_summary: Chemically synthesized astaxanthin (CSA) had the most significant impact on fillet coloration and energy deposition, while wall-unbroken Haematococcus pluvialis (WUHPA) had the least favorable effect. Wall-broken H. pluvialis (WBHPA) improved fillet coloration and nutrient composition, with a recommended dose range of 75-100 mg/kg.
population_specificity: Rainbow trout (Oncorhynchus mykiss) with a mean initial weight of 561 g.
effective_dosage: 0, 25, 50, 75, 100, and 125 mg/kg astaxanthin from WBHPA, 100 mg/kg from WUHPA, or chemically synthesized astaxanthin (CSA), fed twice daily.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Astaxanthin could mitigate ferroptosis during myocardial infarction recovery and improve myocardial remodeling.
results_summary: Astaxanthin inhibited ferroptosis indicators, promoted M2 macrophage polarization, reduced inflammation, and enhanced cardiac function and myocardial remodeling, similar to the effects of Liproxstatin-1.
population_specificity: Rats with myocardial infarction

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether astaxanthin could protect H9c2 cardiomyocytes from cell death caused by hydrogen peroxide and doxorubicin by preserving mitochondrial function and reducing oxidative stress.
results_summary: Astaxanthin increased the resistance of H9c2 cells to hydrogen peroxide and doxorubicin, maintained mitochondrial transmembrane potential, reduced reactive oxygen species production, and elevated levels of mitophagy markers PINK1, Parkin, and prohibitin 2.
population_specificity: H9c2 cardiomyocytes (a rat heart cell line)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the antitumor potential of astaxanthin-based nanoemulsions against gastric cancer cells and their synergistic effect with photodynamic therapy.
results_summary: The study found that astaxanthin-based nanoemulsions inhibited cancer cell proliferation and migration, showed reduced toxicity, and enhanced anti-cancer effects in vivo, particularly when combined with photodynamic therapy. Immunohistological analysis confirmed regulation of the PI3K/AKT signaling pathway.
population_specificity: Human gastric cancer cells and a xenograft mouse model.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether astaxanthin could improve ovarian response and ART outcomes in poor ovarian responders by reducing oxidative stress, inflammation, and apoptosis.
results_summary: Astaxanthin significantly improved antioxidant capacity, reduced inflammatory markers, and enhanced ART outcomes, including increased oocyte retrieval, MII oocytes, and high-quality embryos compared to placebo.
population_specificity: Infertile women with poor ovarian response (POSEIDON Group 4: age >35, poor ovarian reserve).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether astaxanthin affects nociceptive transmission in mice with diabetic neuropathy and its potential to reduce hypersensitivity.
results_summary: Single injections of astaxanthin reduced tactile and thermal hypersensitivity in diabetic mice, regardless of administration route. Repeated astaxanthin administration delayed morphine tolerance and suppressed opioid-induced hyperalgesia, with better analgesic effects when used alone over time.
population_specificity: Streptozotocin-induced diabetic neuropathic pain model in male and female mice.
effective_dosage: Single doses at various levels; repeated twice-daily at 25 mg/kg.
study_duration: Not explicitly stated (implied short-term for single doses and repeated administration over an unspecified period).
interactions: Interaction with morphine noted (delayed tolerance and suppressed hyperalgesia).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop an astaxanthin emulsion stabilized by a soybean isolate protein-hyaluronic acid complex and evaluate its protective effects on astaxanthin stability.
results_summary: Ultrasonication improved the emulsification properties and stability of the SPI-HA complex, resulting in better storage, pH, and light stability for astaxanthin. The emulsion effectively slowed astaxanthin degradation, suggesting potential for controlled release of lipophilic bioactive compounds.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine how astaxanthin (AST) counters oxidative stress and inflammation in chondrocytes via the circ-HP1BP3/miR-139-5p/SOD1 pathway and evaluate the efficacy of AST-loaded sustained-release microspheres for osteoarthritis treatment.
results_summary: AST significantly enhanced SOD1 expression, reduced apoptosis and inflammation in damaged cells, and AST-loaded microspheres showed promising in vitro drug release, improved cell viability, and reduced oxidative stress. In a mouse osteoarthritis model, the microspheres decreased joint inflammation and increased chondrocyte marker expression.
population_specificity: C28/I2 chondrocytes (in vitro) and a mouse model of osteoarthritis (in vivo).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Astaxanthin (ASX) could improve antioxidant status and semen quality in infertile men following varicocelectomy (VCT).
results_summary: ASX significantly improved semen motility, increased antioxidant-related gene expression (NRF2, Keap1, SOD2, BCL2), reduced pro-inflammatory cytokines (TNF-α, IL-1β, IL-6), and elevated total antioxidant capacity (TAC) in seminal fluid, though it did not significantly affect total oxidative stress (TOS).
population_specificity: 40 infertile males with clinical varicocele and abnormal semen analyses.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to elucidate the mechanism by which Astaxanthin mitigates adriamycin-induced cardiotoxicity (AIC).
results_summary: The study identified 248 potential targets of Astaxanthin against AIC, highlighting two core genes (CCL2 and NOS3) and the AGE-RAGE signaling pathway. Molecular docking and dynamics analyses confirmed strong binding affinity between Astaxanthin and these targets.
population_specificity: H9c2 cells (in-vitro model).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether astaxanthin could mitigate radiation-induced cellular senescence in spleen tissues by modulating oxidative stress, inflammation, and specific signaling pathways (STING, mTOR, TLR4).
results_summary: Astaxanthin improved antioxidant/oxidative stress balance, reduced inflammatory biomarkers, and normalized protein expressions linked to cellular senescence in irradiated rats. It demonstrated senomorphic effects via STING, mTOR, and TLR4 pathways.
population_specificity: Male albino rats exposed to 5Gy whole-body gamma-irradiation.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the protective effects of astaxanthin (ASX), krill oil (KO), and fish oil (FO) against ethanol-induced gastric ulcers in rats.
results_summary: ASX supplementation reduced malondialdehyde (MDA) levels and myeloperoxidase (MPO) activity, indicating stronger protection against ethanol-induced gastric lesions compared to KO or FO, which only reduced chemiluminescence levels.
population_specificity: Sprague-Dawley rats (n = 64)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop and evaluate a chitosan and tremella polysaccharide-based nanoemulsion delivery system for astaxanthin to improve its stability, bioavailability, and pH-responsive release.
results_summary: The Ast-CS-TP emulsion demonstrated high encapsulation efficiency, excellent stability under various stresses, enhanced photostability, and improved oral bioavailability. The emulsion showed pH-responsive release and stability in high salt concentrations.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the impact of astaxanthin supplementation on the physiological state, antioxidant capacity, and hormone regulation in porcine ovarian granulosa cells cultured in vitro.
results_summary: Astaxanthin (5 μmol/L) significantly improved cell viability, proliferation, antioxidant capacity, and mitochondrial function while regulating estradiol (E2) and progesterone (P4) levels. It also reduced apoptosis and reactive oxygen species (ROS) levels in porcine granulosa cells.
population_specificity: Porcine ovarian granulosa cells cultured in vitro.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate whether Astaxanthin (AST) has a protective effect against chronic prostatitis/chronic pelvic pain syndrome (CP/CPPS) in rats and to explore its underlying mechanism.
results_summary: AST reduced chronic pelvic pain and prostate inflammation in a dose-dependent manner, suppressed proinflammatory cytokines (IL-1β, IL-6, IL-8, TNF-α), inhibited PGE2 and COX2 activities, and decreased NF-κB signaling pathway activation.
population_specificity: Male rats with CP/CPPS induced by carrageenan.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of astaxanthin compound nutrient (ACN) complementary therapy on pregnancy outcomes in PCOS patients undergoing IVF/ICSI.
results_summary: ACN supplementation improved insulin resistance, hormone levels, embryo quality, and pregnancy outcomes in PCOS patients, with higher numbers of 2PN fertilization, transferable embryos, and high-quality embryos compared to controls.
population_specificity: 92 PCOS patients undergoing IVF/ICSI treatment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether folic acid-modified liposomal nanoparticles loaded with astaxanthin (AST@Lip-FA) could improve targeted delivery, antioxidative effects, and therapeutic efficacy for osteoarthritis (OA).
results_summary: AST@Lip-FA enhanced cellular uptake, reduced inflammatory mediators, and effectively alleviated OA progression in mice by targeting inflamed joints and providing anti-inflammatory, antioxidant, and cartilage-protecting effects.
population_specificity: ACLT-induced OA mouse model

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the potential of astaxanthin as a novel therapeutic option for glioblastoma (GBM) by examining its effects on GBM cells in laboratory and animal models.
results_summary: Astaxanthin demonstrated potential anticancer effects by targeting reactive oxygen species (ROS) and suppressing tumor growth in vitro and in vivo, suggesting it could be a key component in innovative GBM therapies.
population_specificity: Glioblastoma (GBM) cells in laboratory settings and animal models.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the neuroprotective effects of astaxanthin in ischemic stroke, focusing on its potential therapeutic and preventive benefits.
results_summary: The study found that astaxanthin exhibits multiple neuroprotective mechanisms, including antioxidation, anti-inflammation, DNA repair enhancement, anti-cell death, blood-brain barrier protection, and promotion of neuronal survival in ischemic stroke models.
population_specificity: Models of ischemic stroke (not specified if human or animal).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the therapeutic efficacy and mechanisms of Astaxanthin (AST) in managing chronic prostatitis (CP).
results_summary: AST alleviated prostate inflammation and reduced inflammatory cell infiltration in CP rats. It also decreased IL-6 and IL-8 expression in prostate cells, with its anti-inflammatory effects linked to the ERK1/2 pathway.
population_specificity: Male Sprague-Dawley rats and RWPE-1/WPMY-1 prostate cells.
effective_dosage: IC50 values of 171 μM (RWPE-1) and 212.1 μM (WPMY-1) after 48 hours.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the protective effects of Astaxanthin (ASX) on glucose-induced liver injury and insulin resistance in largemouth bass.
results_summary: Astaxanthin improved glucose tolerance, reduced liver injury, and ameliorated insulin resistance by regulating the PTP1B/PI3K/Akt and p38MAPK/bcl-2/caspase-3 pathways. It also enhanced cell viability and reduced apoptosis and oxidative stress in hepatocytes.
population_specificity: Largemouth bass (Micropterus salmoides)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether astaxanthin (MAT) could protect carp hepatocytes from cypermethrin (CY)-induced necroptosis and inflammatory responses by regulating mitochondrial Ca2+ homeostasis and inhibiting the ROS-NF-κB-RIPK3/MLKL signaling pathway.
results_summary: Astaxanthin mitigated CY-induced oxidative stress, necroptosis, and inflammatory responses in carp hepatocytes by restoring antioxidant enzyme activity, reducing ROS levels, and suppressing the ROS-NF-κB-RIPK3/MLKL signaling cascade.
population_specificity: Carp (Cyprinus carpio) hepatocytes

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the impact of astaxanthin supplementation on oxidative stress markers and reproductive outcomes in women with PCOS.
results_summary: Astaxanthin significantly improved total antioxidant capacity (TAC) in follicular fluid but had inconsistent effects on other oxidative stress markers (MDA, CAT, SOD). Reproductive outcomes, such as oocyte quality and high-quality embryos, showed moderate improvements, while fertilization rates and pregnancy outcomes were unaffected.
population_specificity: Women with polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop an effective method for breaking the cell walls of Phaffia rhodozyma and optimizing subcritical fluid extraction to isolate and concentrate astaxanthin from its fermentation products.
results_summary: The study found that lactic acid treatment was the most effective method for disrupting P. rhodozyma cell walls, and optimal subcritical extraction conditions (41 °C, two extractions, 46 min) yielded an astaxanthin concentration of 540.00 mg/L.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study on P. rhodozyma fermentation products).
effective_dosage: Not applicable (extraction conditions: 41 °C, two extractions, 46 min).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the stability and encapsulation efficiency of astaxanthin in sodium caseinate-sugar beet pectin emulsions under various environmental stresses and digestion conditions.
results_summary: M emulsions showed higher astaxanthin encapsulation efficiency (86.85%) compared to L emulsions (72.82%) and better stability against salt addition and pH changes. Astaxanthin degradation rates increased over storage, reaching 61.66% (L) and 54.08% (M) by day 7.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether astaxanthin (AST) could protect against dry eye disease (DED) by modulating the SLC7A11/GPX4 pathway, oxidative stress, autophagy, and ferroptosis.
results_summary: AST activated the SLC7A11/GPX4 pathway, reduced oxidative stress and ferroptosis, enhanced autophagy, and improved mitochondrial structure in DED models. These effects were observed both in vitro and in vivo, suggesting AST's potential therapeutic role in DED.
population_specificity: Dry eye disease models (in vitro corneal epithelial cells and in vivo mouse model).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate whether astaxanthin (AX) could protect rat liver mitochondria from the toxic effects of chronic alcohol consumption and identify its potential targets.
results_summary: AX improved mitochondrial function by positively affecting the mitochondrial permeability transition pore (mPTP), regulating signaling pathways, and maintaining mitochondrial dynamics. It also suppressed alcohol-induced degenerative effects on liver mitochondria.
population_specificity: Rats (Lieber-DeCarly model of chronic alcohol intoxication)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether astaxanthin could mitigate endoplasmic reticulum (ER) stress and cytotoxicity induced by misfolded tau protein in neuronal cells.
results_summary: Astaxanthin significantly reduced cell viability loss, apoptosis, caspase-3 activation, and ER stress in Tau4RDΔK280-expressing N2a cells, while also suppressing reactive oxygen species production and calcium influx.
population_specificity: N2a cells (mouse neuroblastoma cells) stably expressing the pro-aggregant tau repeat domain with the FTDP-17 mutation ΔK280.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of astaxanthin (AST) and low-dose methotrexate (MTX) co-treatment in an acute lymphoblastic leukemia cell line.
results_summary: AST alone and in combination with MTX reduced cell viability, caused cell cycle arrest, decreased expression of DHFR and TYMS, modulated apoptotic and inflammatory genes, inhibited colony formation, and increased antioxidant capacity. The combination therapy showed potential to improve MTX treatment efficacy.
population_specificity: Acute lymphoblastic leukemia cell line (NALM6).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effect of flagella-mediated energy consumption on astaxanthin accumulation in Haematococcus pluvialis.
results_summary: The study found that removing flagella significantly increased astaxanthin content (62.9-91.1% higher than control) and suggested that energy was reallocated from movement to biosynthesis, supported by higher NADPH levels and improved photosynthetic parameters.
population_specificity: Haematococcus pluvialis (microalgae)
